channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Israel accuses two of using military secrets to place Polymarket bets
item.description: The Tel Aviv indictment is the first publicly known instance of people being accused of leveraging military secrets to place bets on the popular prediction market.
item.content:encoded: The Tel Aviv indictment is the first publicly known instance of people being accused of leveraging military secrets to place bets on the popular prediction market.
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: How U.S. sanctions played into the protests in IRan
item.description: The protests in Iran have been about human rights, corruption, freedom — but they were sparked by economic hardship, caused in part by U.S. sanctions. How did they play into the events in Iran?
item.content:encoded: The protests in Iran have been about human rights, corruption, freedom — but they were sparked by economic hardship, caused in part by U.S. sanctions. How did they play into the events in Iran?
item.dc:creator: Mary Childs

item.title: Germany's far right political party, the AFD, is at the Munich Security Conference
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly and Correspondent Rob Schmitz discuss Germany's far-right Alternative for Germany, or AfD, at to the Munich Security Conference.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly and Correspondent Rob Schmitz discuss Germany's far-right Alternative for Germany, or AfD, at to the Munich Security Conference.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: NATO members have launched a new Arctic initiative
item.description: NATO members have launched a new Arctic initiative after President Trump's threats to take over Greenland.
item.content:encoded: NATO members have launched a new Arctic initiative after President Trump's threats to take over Greenland.
item.dc:creator: Teri Schultz

item.title: Iranian exiles in Turkey scramble to find news from home
item.description: Iranians living in Turkey are hearing chilling stories from relatives at home — and receiving death threats themselves.
item.content:encoded: Iranians living in Turkey are hearing chilling stories from relatives at home — and receiving death threats themselves.
item.dc:creator: Durrie Bouscaren

item.title: What is the Munich Security Conference and why is it important?
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Alexandra de Hoop Scheffer, German Marshall Fund president, ahead of the Munich Security Conference.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Alexandra de Hoop Scheffer, German Marshall Fund president, ahead of the Munich Security Conference.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: A look back at noteworthy Munich Security Conference speeches
item.description: World leaders at the Munich Conference have often signaled major historical shifts in their speeches.
item.content:encoded: World leaders at the Munich Conference have often signaled major historical shifts in their speeches.
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: Ukrainians rally in support of Olympian Vladyslav Heraskevych, banned for his helmet
item.description: Ukrainians are uniting in solidarity with Olympic skeleton racer Vladyslav Heraskevych after he was disqualified for wearing a helmet with images of Ukrainian athletes killed during Russia's invasion.
item.content:encoded:
Ukrainians are uniting in solidarity with Olympic skeleton racer Vladyslav Heraskevych after he was disqualified for wearing a helmet with images of Ukrainian athletes killed during Russia's invasion.

(Image credit: Alessandra Tarantino)
item.dc:creator: Polina Lytvynova

item.title: How Nigerian musician Fela Kuti used music as a weapon against dictatorship
item.description: Considered the father of Afrobeat, Kuti used his music in the 1970s to combat colonial values and brutal dictatorship. Podcaster Jad Abumrad tells his story in the series, Fela Kuti: Fear No Man.
item.content:encoded: Considered the father of Afrobeat, Kuti used his music in the 1970s to combat colonial values and brutal dictatorship. Podcaster Jad Abumrad tells his story in the series, Fela Kuti: Fear No Man.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: Kim Jong Un's daughter close to being designated future leader, says spy agency
item.description: Seoul's assessment comes as North Korea is preparing to hold its biggest political conference later this month, where Kim is expected to outline his major policy goals for the next five years.
item.content:encoded:
Seoul's assessment comes as North Korea is preparing to hold its biggest political conference later this month, where Kim is expected to outline his major policy goals for the next five years.

(Image credit: 朝鮮通信社/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
